intro: Euphrasia tenuifolia var. spiralis, commonly known as spiral narrow-leaved eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, spiral-arranged leaves that give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-green flowers with prominent dark markings, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
